news_app.api_urls module

news_app.api_views module

news_app.api_views.article_detail_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to retrieve, update, or delete a specific article. GET: Accessible if approved, or if user is the author/editor. PUT/DELETE: Only by the author or an editor.

news_app.api_views.article_list_create_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to list approved articles (for all authenticated users) or create a new article (for authenticated journalists).

news_app.api_views.journalist_articles_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to retrieve approved articles for a specific journalist. Accessible by any authenticated user.

news_app.api_views.journalist_detail_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to retrieve details of a single journalist. Accessible by any authenticated user.

news_app.api_views.journalist_list_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to list all journalists (users with role=’journalist’). Accessible by any authenticated user.

news_app.api_views.publisher_articles_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to retrieve approved articles for a specific publisher. Accessible by any authenticated user.

news_app.api_views.publisher_detail_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to retrieve details of a single publisher. Accessible by any authenticated user.

news_app.api_views.publisher_list_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to list all publishers. Accessible by any authenticated user.

news_app.api_views.subscribe_api(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint for a reader to subscribe/unsubscribe to a publisher or journalist. Requires ‘type’ (‘publisher’ or ‘journalist’) and ‘id’ of the target, and ‘action’ (‘subscribe’ or ‘unsubscribe’) in the request body.

author

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

articles

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

description

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

news_app.signals module

news_app.signals.article_approved_notification(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]

Sends email notifications to subscribers when an article is approved. Also triggers a tweet if the article is newly approved and Twitter keys are configured.

news_app.tests module

class news_app.tests.NewsAPITests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: APITestCase

Tests for the RESTful API endpoints in the news_app.

setUp()[source]

Set up test data and clients for all API tests.

test_article_creation_by_journalist()[source]

Test that a journalist can create an article via API.

test_article_creation_by_non_journalist()[source]

Test that a non-journalist cannot create an article via API.

test_article_delete_by_author()[source]

Test that an author can delete their own article.

test_article_delete_by_editor()[source]

Test that an editor can delete any article.

test_article_delete_by_unauthorized_user()[source]

Test that a non-author/non-editor cannot delete an article.

test_article_detail_retrieval_approved()[source]

Test retrieving an approved article by its ID.

test_article_detail_retrieval_unapproved_by_author()[source]

Test that an unapproved article CAN be retrieved by its author.

test_article_detail_retrieval_unapproved_by_editor()[source]

Test that an unapproved article CAN be retrieved by an editor.

test_article_detail_retrieval_unapproved_by_unauthorized()[source]

Test that an unapproved article cannot be retrieved by a non-author/non-editor.

test_article_list_retrieval()[source]

Test that only approved articles are returned in the general article list.

test_article_update_by_author()[source]

Test that an author can update their own article.

test_article_update_by_editor()[source]

Test that an editor can update any article.

test_article_update_by_unauthorized_user()[source]

Test that a non-author/non-editor cannot update an article.

test_authenticated_access_allowed()[source]

Ensure authenticated users can access general GET endpoints.

test_journalist_articles_api()[source]

Test retrieving approved articles for a specific journalist.

test_journalist_articles_api_invalid_journalist_id()[source]

Test retrieving articles for a non-existent journalist.

test_journalist_articles_api_no_approved_articles()[source]

Test retrieving articles for a journalist with no approved articles.

test_journalist_articles_api_non_journalist_user_id()[source]

Test retrieving articles using a user ID that is not a journalist.

test_journalist_detail_api()[source]

Test retrieving a single journalist’s details.

test_journalist_list_api()[source]

Test retrieving the list of all journalists.

test_publisher_list_api()[source]

Test that a non-reader cannot use the subscription API.

test_subscribe_journalist_api()[source]

Test that a reader can subscribe to a journalist via API.

test_subscribe_publisher_api()[source]

test_unauthenticated_access_to_api()[source]

Ensure unauthenticated users cannot access any API endpoints.

test_unsubscribe_journalist_api()[source]

Test that a reader can unsubscribe from a journalist via API.

test_unsubscribe_publisher_api()[source]

Test that a reader can unsubscribe from a publisher via API.
